intro: Chaenopleura lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf chenopod, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is adapted to thrive in dry environments, with succulent leaves that help store water. It often grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is commonly found in desert scrub habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
